projects.name: Videography
projects.subtitle: videography
description: From student interviews to aerial drone footage, Annabella gathers video around campus and at university events. These videos can be found on various CU Instagram pages, @CUBOULDERLIFE being the most common channel Annabella produces for.

sections.title: Fall Things to do in Boulder
sections.vid_description: Video romantacizing the fall season in Boulder.

sections.title: Wes Anderson
sections.vid_description: Annabella's attempt at showcasing campus through the eye of director Wes Anderson. She emphasizes his attention to symmetry and similar cinematic shots. She also used a similar preset to potray a similar vibe.

sections.title: Life at CU
sections.vid_description: Hype video to advertise what your life at CU may look like. Meant to attract incoming freshmen.

sections.title: Small Town called Boulder
sections.vid_description: Annabella having fun with a trending audio and giving it her own twist.

sections.title: Places to Eat on the Hill
sections.vid_description: This is an example of an interview-type video. Annabella would often make these kinds of videos for the university highlighting a variety of questions.

sections.title: Human first, student second
sections.vid_description: Video highlighting places on Pearl Street while portraying a thoughtful message to students during finals week.

projects.name: Photography
projects.subtitle: photography
description: From football games to cars, Annabella collects photos from a variety of university events and self-interests.

images.title: 'Get Hype'
images.description: Travis Jay raising arms, attempting to get the stadium crowd excited.

images.title: 'Dynamic Duo'
images.description: Travis Hunter celebrating with Shedeur Sanders after touchdown.

images.title: 'Twos Up'
images.description: Shedeur Sanders holding up his number after completing a touchdown.

images.title: 'Side Profile'
images.description: Shedeur Sanders looking to the side.

images.title: 'Game Face'
images.description: Shedeur Sanders showing his focused game-face.

images.title: 'Hunter Embrace'
images.description: Travis Hunter hugging loved ones in stands after win.

images.title: 'Sko Buffs'
images.description: Cheerleader getting the crowd excited for the game.

images.title: 'Flag Wave'
images.description: Ralphie Runner waving the CU flag at field corner.

images.title: 'Venue'
images.description: The concert with backdrop of flatirons.

images.title: 'Stage Glow'
images.description: The red glow of the stage lights illuminate the crowd.

images.title: 'Stage'
images.description: Backshot of the concert, from the view of one from the crowd.

images.title: 'Rockin Out'
images.description: Hippie Sabotage brother flipping his hair while playing guitar.

images.title: 'Hippie Moon'
images.description: Hippie Sabotage brother illuminated by the moonlight and fans' phone flashlights.

projects.name: Design
projects.subtitle: design
description: Sensory extensions enhance our awareness by transforming variations in stimuli normally undetectable by human senses into perceivable outputs.
